EventItemActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.6773, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.9803, “AN ACT to amend the civil service law, in relation to suspension of employees of the department of parks in cities having a population of one million or more”.
EventItemMatterName: Suspension of employees of the parks dept. one million plus (S.6773, A.9803).

EventItemActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.5589-A, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.8704-A, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to terminal leave”.
EventItemMatterName: Terminal leave.

EventItemActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Marchi, S.6899, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.10154, “AN ACT to amend chapter 697 of the laws of 2004, amending the general municipal law relating to certain disabilities incurred by members of the uniformed force of sanitation departments, in relation to extending the provisions of such chapter”.
EventItemMatterName: Uniformed sanitation force incurring disabilities (S.6899, A.10154).

EventItemActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.7119-A, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.10530, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to accidental disability for certain members of the New York city employees’ retirement system or the New York city board of education retirement system”.
EventItemMatterName: Accidental disability for certain members of the NYC employees’ retirement system or the NYC board of education retirement system (S.7119-A, A.10530).

EventItemActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.3972-A, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.6381-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the employment of retired New York city police personnel”.
EventItemMatterName: Employment of retired NYC police personnel.

EventItemActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.7417, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.10871, “AN ACT to amend the civil service law, in relation to the suspension of certain employees in cities having a population of one million or more”.
EventItemMatterName: Suspension of certain employees in cities with one million plus.

EventItemActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.7239-A, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.10273-A, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, and the retirement and social security law, in relation to the pensions of registered nurse and midwife members of the New York city employees’ retirement system”.
EventItemMatterName: Pensions of RN's and midwife members of NYCERS.

EventItemActionText: This Mayor's Message was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the number of intersections where traffic-control signal photo violation-monitoring systems may be installed and operated, and reporting upon the use of such systems and relating to the civil liability of vehicle owners for traffic-control signal violations.” A.8038-C / S.5357-B
EventItemMatterName: Increasing the number of intersections where traffic-control signal photo violation-monitoring systems may be installed and operated/

EventItemActionText: This Mayor's Message was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the rate of regular interest used in the actuarial valuation of liabilities for the purpose of calculating contributions to the New York city employees' retirement system, the New York city teachers' retirement system, the police pension fund, subchapter two, the fire department pension fund, subchapter two and the board of education retirement system of such city by public employers and other obligors  required  to  make employer contributions to such retirement systems, the making of contributions to  such  retirement  systems  by such public employers and such other obligors, including contributions for  administrative expenses, investment expenses and certain cost-of-living adjustments, and the crediting of special  interest  and  additional  interest to members of such retirement systems, and the allowance of  supplementary  interest  on  the  funds  of  such  retirement systems;  and  to  amend  the  education  law, in relation to employer contributions to the board of education retirement system of such city.” A.10470 / S.7840
EventItemMatterName: The rate of regular interest used in the actuarial valuation of liabilities for the purpose of calculating contributions to the NYC employees' retirement system.

EventItemActionText: This Mayor's Message was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the business corporation law, the not-for-profit corporation law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the dissolution of a corporation responsible for the payment of taxes to the city of New York.” A.7459 / S.5170
EventItemMatterName: The dissolution of a corporation responsible for the payment of taxes to NYC.

EventItemActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
EventItemActionText: This Mayor's Message was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
EventItemTitle: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the chief of department of the fire department of the city of New York.” A.10836-A / S.7844-B
EventItemMatterName: Chief of department of the fire department of the city of New York.” A.10836-A / S.7844-B

EventItemActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
EventItemActionText: This Mayor's Message was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
EventItemTitle: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, and chapter 1032 of the laws of 1960, relating to enabling any city of one million or more to impose taxes on certain motor vehicles, in relation to authorizing the department of motor vehicles to collect and administer such taxes with respect to certain motor vehicles, and to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to imposing taxes on certain motor vehicles.” A.11120 / S.7937
EventItemMatterName: Enabling any city of one million or more to impose taxes on certain motor vehicles (A.11120 / S.7937)

EventItemActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
EventItemActionText: This Mayor's Message was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
EventItemTitle: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT in relation to authorizing the public sale of taxicab licenses in the city of New York.” A.11593 / S.8048
EventItemMatterName: Authorizing the public sale of taxicab licenses in the city of New York.” A.11593 / S.8048

EventItemTitle: AND SUCH OTHER BUSINESS AS MAY BE NECESSARY

EventItemActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.4081-B, and Assembly Member Perry, A.1445-B, “AN ACT to amend the New York city charter, the vehicle and traffic law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the “open driveway act” regarding the environmental control board adjudication of disputes concerning the blocking of a driveway; and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof”.
EventItemMatterName: Open Driveway Act (S.4081-B, A.1445-B)

EventItemActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Krueger, S.2522-A, and Assembly Member Gottfried, A.6535-A, “AN ACT to authorize the New York city employees’ retirement system to accept an application for a Final Medical Review from Barry Kimmel”.
EventItemMatterName: Accept an application for a final medical review from Barry Kimmel.

EventItemActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
EventItemActionText: This Mayor's Message was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
EventItemTitle: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to permitting certain retirees of a public retirement system to earn compensation from service as a New York city marshal without suspension or reduction of retirement benefits.” A.11089 / S.7853-A
EventItemMatterName: Permitting certain retirees of a public retirement system to earn compensation from service as a NYC marshal without suspension or reduction of retirement benefits.” (A.11089/S.7853-A)

EventItemActionText: This Mayor's Message was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to authorize the city of New York to discontinue certain land as park land.” A.11288-A / S.7920-A
EventItemMatterName: Discontinue certain land as park land.

EventItemActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.6299-A, and Assembly Member Cymbrowitz, A.9242-A, “AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to certain impairments of health presumed incurred in the performance of duty”.
EventItemMatterName: Impairments of health presumed incurred in the performance of duty (S.6299-A, A.9242-A).

EventItemActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.4458-D, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.7395-B, “AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to expanded coverage for disabilities caused by stroke”.
EventItemMatterName: Expanded coverage for disabilities caused by stroke.

EventItemActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
EventItemActionText: This SLR was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
EventItemTitle: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Paterson, S.8089, and Assembly Member Farrell, A.10492, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Manhattan to Childs Memorial Church of God and Christ, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 1911, Lot No. 41 on tax map for the borough of Manhattan”.
EventItemMatterName: Reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in Brooklyn to Childs Memorial Church of God and Christ. (S.8089/A.10492)

EventItemActionText: This SLR was Hearing Held by Committee
EventItemTitle: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Montgomery, S.3265, and Assembly Member Robinson, A.6376, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner Robert Cradle, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 1832, Lot No. 9 on tax map for the borough of Brooklyn”.
EventItemMatterName: In Rem, former owner Robert Cradle, Block No.1832, Lot No.9 Brooklyn (S.3265/ A.6376)

EventItemTitle: Roll Call

EventItemActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be P-C Item Approved by Comm approved by Roll Call.
EventItemTitle: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Paterson, S.8089, and Assembly Member Farrell, A.10492, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Manhattan to Childs Memorial Church of God and Christ, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 1911, Lot No. 41 on tax map for the borough of Manhattan”.
EventItemMatterName: Reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in Brooklyn to Childs Memorial Church of God and Christ. (S.8089/A.10492)
